text: At CloudCall we are a telco-focused CRM integration telco provider.
We traditionally were on-premise, and we started on this journey
to move up to the AWS cloud to allow us to really locate closer
to our customers and speed up the process of being able to deploy new features and in new regions, really quickly.
We had varying levels of knowledge across the team

and that's when we really started
to look at different ways of learning and
enabling the teams to increase their skills with AWS.

Having the ability to give them
something like Skills Builder really meant
we could get everyone up to that base level of knowledge
and in a really good way that suited all of the different styles of learning.

So we wanted to give people
the flexibility to learn

how worked best for them, and also allow
them to work it within their schedule.

They could go in more in-depth in
those areas that really were

vitally important to them, but
maybe not apply so much to other people.
We sync contacts from our customers' CRMs

into the CloudCall systems to enable us to
work with the telephony side of things.
And it was a real bottleneck for us and it was a process that
could take five, six hours before and it was commonly failing.

But once we managed to get the team
working on that, upskilled and working with
AWS Skill Builder, they actually managed to pretty quickly apply
that to rebuild that entire system in a completely serverless way.

And that process now takes 15-20 minutes
and it's gone from being something

that was a real pain point for us, to something
that we just don't think about anymore.

The engineers really enjoy learning
with AWS. They can go in and build
all sorts of different things and really deliver things quickly.
We've had great support from, right away, across AWS, from our account team
and also with the training and certification team.
